result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel T. Gremler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, and for any week defendant does not meet that requirment he must perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with either victims named in complaint.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM606 and 15CM669 called: 9:28am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty John Zich.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 15CM669.  (Sent After Rev in 14CM606) VRCW

State moves to :
15CM669 - Ct. 1 (4th Degree Sexual Assault/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CM669 - Ct. 2 (4th Degree Sexual Assault/Repeater)>>AMEND to DC/Repeater
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM669 - Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
15CM669 - Ct. 3 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 

14CM606 - 120 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/childcare if defendant qualifies under jail classification system w/credit for 57 days of time already served.
15CM669>>Sentence W/held on each count; 1 year Probation on each count concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with either of the victims named in complaint; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling  or combination thereof, and for any week defendant does not meet that requirement he must perform 10 hours of c.s./week; CC.

Adj: 9:39am

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Plea hearing on May 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall not consume alcohol.   No contact with victim(s): S.N.C. & B.E.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
